titles.ar: باب الْأَسْوِقَةِ وَ فَضْلِ سَوِيقِ الْحِنْطَةِ
titles.en: Chapter 53 – The Suweyq (flour soup) and the preference of the Suweyq of wheat

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: صحيح - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (22/123)

narrator_chain.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنْ يُونُسَ عَنْ أَبِي الْحَسَنِ الرِّضَا ( عليه السلام ) أَنَّ

text: هُ قَالَ مَا دَخَلَ جَوْفَ الْمَسْلُولِ شَيْ‏ءٌ أَنْفَعُ لَهُ مِنْ خُبْزِ الْأَرُزِّ .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from Muhammad Bin Isa, form Yunus,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Al-Hassan Al-Reza<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘There does not enter the inside of the (sufferer of) tuberculosis, anything more beneficial for him than the rice bread’.
en.sarwar: 1. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from Muhammad ibn ‘Isa from Yunus who has said the following: “Abu al-Hassan, al-Rida’, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said, ‘Nothing more useful enters the stomach of one suffering from Tuberculosis than bread of rice.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: ضعيف - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (2/123)

narrator_chain.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ مُوسَى عَنِ الْخَشَّابِ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ حَسَّانَ عَنْ بَعْضِ أَصْحَابِنَا قَالَ

text: قَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) أَطْعِمُوا الْمَبْطُونَ خُبْزَ الْأَرُزِّ فَمَا دَخَلَ جَوْفَ الْمَبْطُونِ شَيْ‏ءٌ أَنْفَعُ مِنْهُ أَمَا إِنَّهُ يَدْبُغُ الْمَعِدَةَ وَ يَسُلُّ الدَّاءَ سَلًّا .

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Muhammad Bin Musa, from Al Khashaab, form Ali Bin Hassan, from one of our companions who said,

‘Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Feed the rice bread to the (sufferer of) stomach ailments, for there does not enter the inside of the (sufferer of) stomach ailments anything more beneficial to him than it; at the same time it repairs the stomach and pulls out the illness of tuberculosis’.
en.sarwar: 2. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Muhammad ibn Musa from al-Khashshab from Ali ibn Hassan from certain persons of our people who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said, ‘Feed bread of rice to a person suffering from diarrhea; nothing else is more useful for such a sufferer than this, it also tans (treats) the stomach and dispels the pain sufficiently.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: ضعيف - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (2/123)

narrator_chain.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ السَّيَّارِيِّ عَنْ يَحْيَى بْنِ أَبِي رَافِعٍ وَ غَيْرِهِ يَرْفَعُونَهُ إِلَى أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: لَيْسَ يَبْقَى فِي الْجَوْفِ مِنْ غُدْوَةٍ إِلَى اللَّيْلِ إِلَّا خُبْزُ الْأَرُزِّ .

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Al Sayyari, from Yahya Bin Abu Rafi’a, and someone else,
(It has been narrated) raising it to Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘Nothing from the early morning meal remains inside up to the night, except for the rice bread’.
en.sarwar: 3. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from af-Sayyariy from Yahya ibn abu Rafi’ and other in a marfu‘ manner has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said, ‘No other food from lunch remains inside until night except bread of rice.’”
